StringTable.Label: Recapitalize_Dec
StringTable.String: Generate new capital through recapitalization with your reserve currency status.

StringTable.Label: SpawnMiner_Dec
StringTable.String: Engage skilled miners to extract valuable resources efficiently and boost your productivity.

StringTable.Label: SpawnFreighter_Dec
StringTable.String: Contract experienced merchants to man a ship to expand your trade routes.

StringTable.Label: AddSiege_Dec
StringTable.String: Install shock troopers on target ship to assist in conquering worlds.

StringTable.Label: GiveHope_Dec
StringTable.String: Give a series of inspirational speeches to the target core world to incresae their approval.

StringTable.Label: Mitosis_Dec
StringTable.String: Splits an Irradiated being into two creating resulting in a new one on target planet.

StringTable.Label: Swarm_Dec
StringTable.String: For six months all members of our species that have the [HS=HS_Consuming]Consuming[/HS] will see their abilities doubled.

StringTable.Label: PlanetVision_Dec
StringTable.String: Greatly expand the sensor vision of the target world to see what is remotely near it. Effect begins one month later.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_ZoneOfControlDec
StringTable.String: The Zone of Control marks where a civilization's Influence extends to and is dominant. The Zone of Control is represented by shading the galaxy, the dominant Civilization's color. Multiple Civilizations may have Influence over a cell, but the Civilization with the highest Influence in the cell will be granted the cell.[BR][BR]Some actions are affected by the Zone of Control. Specific actions like mining asteroids can only be performed on objects within the Zone of Control. Other actions, like building Starbases, that can be performed outside the Zone of Control can not be performed in other Civilizations' Zone of Control.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_TileDec
StringTable.String: The game space is divided into hexagonal Tiles. Distance is measured by the number of Tiles between locations. The grid of Tiles can be turned on and off in the Options Menu under Interface. Toggling Show Grid When Close and Show Grid When Far will set whether tiles are visible at certain zoom distances.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_MonthsDec
StringTable.String: Every game occurs in turns. A Month measures the amount of time between turns. A month passes after every Civilization has taken its turn.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_MovesDec
StringTable.String: Every Ship and Fleet has a set amount of [ICON=Moves_Icon] Moves. [ICON=Moves_Icon] Moves are the number of [HS=HS_Tile]Tiles[/HS] the Ship or Fleet can traverse in a [HS=HS_Months]Month[/HS].[BR][BR]

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_ShipDec
StringTable.String: A ship is any individual mobile unit.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_FleetDec
StringTable.String: A Fleet is a group of [HS=HS_Ship]Ships[/HS]. Fleets can be formed by [HS=HS_ShipMovement]Moving[/HS] [HS=HS_Ship]Ships[/HS] onto the same [HS=HS_Tile]Tile[/HS]. How many [HS=HS_Ship]Ships[/HS] can be in a Fleet is determined by the current [HS=HS_Logistics]Logistics[/HS]. Each [HS=HS_Ship]Ship[/HS] has a [HS=HS_Logistics]Logistics[/HS] value and will add to the current Fleet's [HS=HS_Logistics]Logistics[/HS] score. If a [HS=HS_Ship]Ship[/HS] has a higher [HS=HS_Logistics]Logistics[/HS] score than the Fleet can incorporate, it will be unable to join the Fleet.[BR][BR]Utilizing Fleets is vital to survival. Groups of [HS=HS_Ship]Ships[/HS] do better in combat than individual [HS=HS_Ship]Ships[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_ShipMovementDec
StringTable.String: Individual [HS=HS_Ship]Ships[/HS] and [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleets[/HS] can be moved around the galaxy by selecting the [HS=HS_Ship]Ship[/HS] or [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleet[/HS] with the LEFT Mouse Button and then designating a [HS=HS_Tile]Tile[/HS] to move to with the RIGHT Mouse Button.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_PlanetTypeDec
StringTable.String: Planet Type is the classification of a planet's biome and general environment. Different Planet Types often have different terrains in different amounts, determining what resources the planet can provide.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_PlanetClassDec
StringTable.String: Planet Class is a measurement of the habitable space of a planet. Any planet with a Planet Class of 1 or greater can be [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonized[/HS]. The higher the Planet Class, the more space there is for development. Planets with a higher Planet Class generally provide more resources than planets of a lower Planet Class of the identical [HS=HS_PlanetType]Planet Type[/HS].[BR][BR]Planets with a Planet Class of 0 are considered a [HS=HS_DeadWorld]Dead World[/HS] and can not be colonized.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_DeadWorldDec
StringTable.String: A Dead World is any planet with a [HS=HS_PlanetClass]Planet Class[/HS] of 0. Dead Worlds can not be colonized.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_ColinizingDec
StringTable.String: Colonizing new worlds is essential to expand a Civilization's [HS=HS_ZoneOfControl]Zone of Control[/HS] and gaining access to more resources. Planets can only be [HS=HS_ColonizeOrder]Colonized[/HS] if there is no claim to the planet. Once a Planet is Colonized, it is claimed by the Colonizing Civilization. [BR][BR]A Planet must have a [HS=HS_PlanetClass]Planet Class[/HS] 1 or greater to be Colonized. Planets with a Planet Class of 0 are considered a [HS=HS_DeadWorld]Dead World[/HS] and can not be colonized.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_ColonizeOrderDec
StringTable.String: Colony Ships can be used to [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonize[/HS] new worlds. To [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonize[/HS] a planet, first, select the [HS=HS_Ship]Ship[/HS] with the LEFT Mouse Button. With the appropriate [HS=HS_Ship]Ship[/HS] selected, order the [HS=HS_Ship]Ship[/HS] to [HS=HS_ShipMovement]Move[/HS] to a planet with a [HS=HS_PlanetClass]Planet Class[/HS] of 1 or greater with the RIGHT Mouse Button. It may take several [HS=HS_Months]Months[/HS], but once the Colony Ship reaches the planet, it will colonize it tktkif abletktk.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_SurveyOrderDec
StringTable.String: The galaxy is often filled with [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomalies[/HS] that can be Surveyed by a [HS=HS_SurveyShip]Survey Ship[/HS]. To order a [HS=HS_Ship]Ship[/HS] to Survey an [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomaly[/HS], begin by selecting the [HS=HS_SurveyShip]Survey Ship[/HS] with the LEFT Mouse Button. Then order the [HS=HS_Ship]Ship[/HS] to [HS=HS_ShipMovement]Move[/HS] to the [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomaly[/HS] location. Once the [HS=HS_Ship]Ship[/HS] arrives at its destination, it will begin to Survey the [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomaly[/HS]. Surveying takes several [HS=HS_Months]Months[/HS].[BR][BR]A ship that is moved, attacked, or otherwise interrupted will lose all progress, and the Survey will need to start from the start.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_AttackOrderDec
StringTable.String: There are many threats in the galaxy, and often offensive actions must be taken. [HS=HS_Ship]Ships[/HS] and [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleets[/HS] that have weapons can Attack other entities. To order an Attack, select the [HS=HS_Ship]Ship[/HS] or [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleet[/HS] with the LEFT Mouse Button. Then order the [HS=HS_Ship]Ship[/HS] or [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleet[/HS] to [HS=HS_ShipMovement]Move[/HS] to the target's location with the RIGHT Mouse Button. Once the destination is reached, combat will begin.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_AutoExploreDec
StringTable.String: [ICON=AutoExplore_Icon] Auto-Explore is an option that will set [HS=HS_Ship]Ships[/HS] to move without direct orders. [HS=HS_Ship]Ships[/HS] in [ICON=AutoExplore_Icon] Auto-Explore will move to destinations that are currently unknown and uncharted.[BR][BR]If the entire galaxy is explored and there are no uncharted [HS=HS_Tile]Tiles[/HS], the [ICON=AutoExplore_Icon] Auto-Explore option will become unavailable.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_AutoSurveyDec
StringTable.String: [ICON=AutoSurvey_Icon] Auto-Survey is only available to [HS=HS_Ship]Ships[/HS] with Survey Modules. A [HS=HS_Ship]Ship[/HS] in [ICON=AutoSurvey_Icon] Auto-Survey mode will move without direct orders, trying to locate [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomalies[/HS]. When a [HS=HS_Ship]Ship[/HS] in [ICON=AutoSurvey_Icon] Auto-Survey mode is near an [HS=HS_Anomaly ]Anomaly[/HS], it will [HS=HS_SurveyOrder]Survey[/HS] the [HS=HS_Anomaly ]Anomaly[/HS] without direct orders.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_AutoColonizeDec
StringTable.String: [ICON=AutoColonize_Icon] Auto-Colonize is only available to ships that can [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonize[/HS] a planet. A [HS=HS_Ship]Ship[/HS] in [ICON=AutoColonize_Icon] Auto-Colonize mode will move without direct orders, trying to locate planets with a [HS=HS_PlanetClass]Planet Class[/HS] of 1 or greater. When a planet is found, the [HS=HS_Ship]Ship[/HS] will [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonize[/HS] the planet without direct orders.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_AutoMineDec
StringTable.String: [ICON=AutoMine_Icon] Auto-Mine is an option for Asteroid Mining ships. A [HS=HS_Ship]Ship[/HS] in [ICON=AutoMine_Icon] Auto-Mine will move without direct orders to try and find Asteroids within the [HS=HS_ZoneOfControl]Zone of Control[/HS] to mine.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_SectorDec
StringTable.String: A Sector is an area of the Galaxy where Stars Systems are grouped together and can be traversed without specialized [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_LeaderMenuDec
StringTable.String: The [ICON=Menu_Leader_Icon] Leaders Menu is where [HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] can be recruited and managed. Under the [ICON=Menu_Leader_Icon] Leaders Menu, there are screens for [HS=HS_RecruitmentScreen]Recruitment[/HS], [HS=HS_MinistersScreen]Ministers[/HS], [HS=HS_GovernorsScreen]Governors[/HS], [HS=HS_DiplomatsScreen]Diplomats[/HS], [HS=HS_CommandersScreen]Commanders[/HS], and [HS=HS_FactionsScreen]Factions[/HS].[BR][BR]Access the [ICON=Menu_Leader_Icon] Leaders Menu by selecting the icon on the Radial Menu with the LEFT Mouse Button.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_RecruitmentScreenDec
StringTable.String: The Recruitment Screen can be accessed through the [ICON=Menu_Leader_Icon] [HS=HS_LeaderMenu]Leaders Menu[/HS]. Potential [HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] will appear under the Recruitment Screen, where they can be assessed and hired.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_MinistersScreenDec
StringTable.String: The Ministers Screen can be accessed through the [ICON=Menu_Leader_Icon] [HS=HS_LeaderMenu]Leaders Menu[/HS]. Minister Offices provide specific benefits to the whole Civilization based on the stats of the installed [HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS]. Minister Offices without a [HS=HS_Leaders]Leader[/HS] assigned provide no benefits. Hovering the Mouse over an office will provide specific information about the office and its benefits.[BR][BR][HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] can be assigned, unassigned, and reassigned at any point during your turn.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_GovernorsScreenDec
StringTable.String: The Governors Screen can be accessed through the [ICON=Menu_Leader_Icon] [HS=HS_LeaderMenu]Leaders Menu[/HS]. The Governors Screen briefly overviews every colonized planet with a [HS=HS_PlanetClass]Planet Class[/HS] of 10 or greater. If there is a [HS=HS_Leaders]Leader[/HS] assigned to the planet, the planet is a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS].[BR][BR][HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] can be assigned, unassigned, and reassigned at any point during your turn.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_DiplomatsScreenDec
StringTable.String: The Diplomats Screen can be accessed through the [ICON=Menu_Leader_Icon] [HS=HS_LeaderMenu]Leaders Menu[/HS]. The Diplomat Screen briefly overviews our relationship with all other known Civilizations. [HS=HS_Leaders]Leader[/HS] can be assigned as [HS=HS_Diplomat]Diplomats[/HS] to affect your relationship with other Civilizations.[BR][BR][HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] can be assigned, unassigned, and reassigned at any point during your turn.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_CommandersScreenDec
StringTable.String: The Commanders Screen can be accessed through the [ICON=Menu_Leader_Icon] [HS=HS_LeaderMenu]Leaders Menu[/HS]. The Commanders Screen displays all Command Ships available to the Civilization. Command Ships can be deployed by assigning a [HS=HS_Leaders]Leader[/HS] to the ship.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_FactionsScreenDec
StringTable.String: The Factions Screen can be accessed through the [ICON=Menu_Leader_Icon] [HS=HS_LeaderMenu]Leaders Menu[/HS]. Factions are groups within a Civilization that affect specific stats and resources. Assigning a [HS=HS_Leaders]Leader[/HS] to a Faction causes the effects to change. More than one [HS=HS_Leaders]Leader[/HS] can be assigned to a faction.[BR][BR][HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] can be assigned, unassigned, and reassigned at any point during your turn.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_CivilizationMenuDec
StringTable.String: The [ICON=Menu_CivilizationMenu_Icon] Civilization Menu provides an overview of your entire Civilization and a few tools to manage your Civilization on a larger scale. In the [ICON=Menu_CivilizationMenu_Icon] Civilization Menu, the [HS=HS_Taxes]Tax Rate[/HS] and [HS=HS_Policy]Policies[/HS] can be set.[BR][BR]Access the [ICON=Menu_CivilizationMenu_Icon] Civilization Menu by selecting the icon on the Radial Menu with the LEFT Mouse Button.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_SupportingColoniesDec
StringTable.String: A Supporting Colony is any [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonized[/HS] planet that isn't a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS]. A Supporting Colony sends resources to the nearest [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS] as Input, increasing the [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World's[/HS] Planetary Input to improve the planet's Output.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_MineralsDec
StringTable.String: Minerals are the raw materials available to a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS]. Minerals are an Input that affects [ICON=Manufacturing_Stat_Icon] [HS=HS_Manufacturing]Manufacturing[/HS]. The more Minerals a planet has as Input, the higher its [HS=HS_Manufacturing]Manufacturing[/HS] rating.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_TechnologyDec
StringTable.String: [ICON=Stat_Technology_Icon] Technology measures intellectual development available to a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS]. [ICON=Stat_Technology_Icon] Technology is an Input that affects [ICON=Stat_Research_Icon] [HS=HS_Research]Research[/HS]. The more [ICON=Stat_Technology_Icon] Technology a planet has as Input, the higher its [ICON=Stat_Research_Icon] [HS=HS_Research]Research[/HS] rating.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_FarmingDec
StringTable.String: [ICON=Stat_Fertility_Icon] Farming measures the resources agriculture produces available to a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS]. [ICON=Stat_Fertility_Icon] Farming is an Input that affects [ICON=Stat_Food_Icon] [HS=HS_Food]Food[/HS]. The more [ICON=Stat_Fertility_Icon] Farming a planet has as Input, the more [ICON=Stat_Food_Icon] [HS=HS_Food]Food[/HS] the [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS] produces.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_CultureDec
StringTable.String: [ICON=Stat_PlanetInfluence_Icon] Culture measures the social significance available to a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS]. [ICON=Stat_PlanetInfluence_Icon] Culture is an Input that affects [ICON=Stat_Influence_Icon] [HS=HS_Influence]Influence[/HS]. The more [ICON=Stat_PlanetInfluence_Icon] Culture a planet has as Input, the higher its [ICON=Stat_Influence_Icon] [HS=HS_Influence]Influence[/HS] rating.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_WealthDec
StringTable.String: [ICON=Stat_Wealth_Icon] Wealth is the rare and precious materials available to a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS]. [ICON=Stat_Wealth_Icon] Wealth is an Input that affects [ICON=Stat_Income_Icon] [HS=HS_ColonyGrossIncome]Income[/HS]. The more [ICON=Stat_Wealth_Icon] Wealth a planet has as Input, the more [ICON=Stat_Income_Icon] [HS=HS_ColonyGrossIncome]Income[/HS] it produces.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_ResearchCenterDec
StringTable.String: The Research Center is a menu that provides an overview of [HS=HS_Tech]Techs[/HS] being researched and allows you to change what [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS] is being researched at any time during your turn. The rate at which [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS] is researched is measured in [HS=HS_Months]Month[/HS] and determined by your Civilizaton's [ICON=Stat_Research_Icon] [HS=HS_Research]Research[/HS]. At the start of a turn, if a [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS] is completed being Researched, you'll gain access to the Unlocks and have to designate a new [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS] to research.[BR][BR]Select a [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS] to research with the LEFT Mouse Button. The currently [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS] being researched is always displayed in the bottom central panel.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_TechDec
StringTable.String: A Tech is an option at the [HS=HS_ResearchCenter]Research Center[/HS] that, when Researched, will provide distinct Unlocks that can be new [HS=HS_Ship]Ships[/HS], [HS=HS_Improvement]Improvements[/HS], [HS=HS_ExecutiveOrders]Executive Orders[/HS] and more.[BR][BR]Learn more about what a Tech unlocks by hovering the Mouse over the Tech in the [HS=HS_ResearchCenter]Research Center[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_PiratesDec
StringTable.String: Pirates are rogue [HS=HS_Ship]Ships[/HS], [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS], and planets. By default, Pirates are hostile to all other groups and Civilizations. They can and will engage ships in combat, especially if they think they'll win the fight.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_ShipyardDec
StringTable.String: A Shipyard is where new [HS=HS_Ship]Ships[/HS] can be constructed. Shipyards require a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS] to operate and can only be built from [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core Worlds[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_RushDec
StringTable.String: The Rush option allows you to spend [ICON=Stat_Credits_Icon][HS=HS_Credit]Credits[/HS] and [ICON=Stat_Control_Icon] [HS=HS_Control]Control[/HS] to reduce the time to complete a construction to 1 [HS=HS_Months]Month[/HS]. A Rushed construction always moves to the front of the Queue. The Rush option can only be used once per turn on each [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS] and [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_PlanetManagementDec
StringTable.String: The [ICON=Menu_PlanetManagement_Icon] Planet Management Window is where you can manage your [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core Worlds[/HS]. You can get detailed breakdowns of the planet's Input and Output along with the status of the planet. You can also construct and deconstruct [HS=HS_Improvement]Improvements[/HS] along with managing Projects.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_AdjacencyDec
StringTable.String: The Adjacency Bonus applies to [HS=HS_Improvement]Improvements[/HS] built next to each other. To maximize efficiency, it's best to construct similar [HS=HS_Improvement]Improvements[/HS] in adjacent tiles to boost their bonus.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_ConstructStarbaseDec
StringTable.String: The Construct Starbase order can be given to [HS=HS_Constructor]Constructor[/HS]. This will consume the [HS=HS_Constructor]Constructor[/HS] and create a [HS=HS_Starbase]Starbase[/HS] of a chosen type. [HS=HS_Starbase]Starbases[/HS] can not be constructed in another player's [HS=HS_ZoneOfControl]Zone of Control[/HS] or within 3 [HS=HS_Tile]Tiles[/HS] of another [HS=HS_Starbase]Starbase[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_StarbaseDec
StringTable.String: A Starbase is a specialized immobile construction that can serve a variety of roles, depending on where and how it is built. To build a Starbase, produce a [HS=HS_Constructor]Constructor[/HS] from a [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS]. A Constructor can then be given the [HS=HS_ConstructStarbase]Construct Starbase[/HS] command to create a Starbase at its current location.[BR][BR]There are four types of Starbases: [ICON=Icon_MiltaryStarbase] [HS=HS_MilitaryStarbase]Military[/HS], [ICON=Icon_MiningStarbase] [HS=HS_MininingStarbase]Mining[/HS], [ICON=Icon_EconomicsStarbase] [HS=HS_EconomicsStarbase]Economic[/HS], and [ICON=Icon_MiningStarbase] [HS=HS_CommunicationsStarbase]Communication[/HS]. The types available when using the [HS=HS_ConstructStarbase]Construct Starbase [/HS] depends on the resources within the [HS=HS_Constructor]Constructor's[/HS] area of effect.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_MilitaryStarbaseDec
StringTable.String: Dedicates Starbase to protecting your Civilization and its assets

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_MiningStarbaseDec
StringTable.String: Dedicates Starbase to mining nearby [HS=HS_StrategicResource]Strategic Resources[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_CommunicationsStarbaseDec
StringTable.String: Dedicates Starbase to extending your cultural Influence and assets.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_EconomicsStarbaseDec
StringTable.String: Dedicates Starbase to building up the economy of your Core Worlds.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_ConqueringPlanetsDec
StringTable.String: All colonized planets have a [ICON=Conquest_Icon] Planetary Conquest rating. This represents how defended a planet is and how much military might it will take to overcome its defenses. [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleets[/HS] have a Conquest Rating, representing how equipped they are to besiege a planet. Some ships, like Transport ships, are better equipped to Conquer planets than others.[BR][BR]To initiate a siege, issue a [HS=HS_ShipMovement]Move[/HS] command to a [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleet[/HS] with the target being the Planet to conquer. When the [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleet[/HS] reaches the Planet, it will initiate a siege if its [ICON=Conquest_Icon] Conquest Rating is high enough to overcome the Planet's [ICON=Conquest_Icon] Conquest Rating.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_StandbyDec
StringTable.String: The Standby order can be used to have a ship idle indefinitely. Unlike other orders that have scenarios where a ship stops idling, ships in Standby will not leave Standby mode until ordered to do so.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_BiologyDec
StringTable.String: Biologies are special traits that affect how a civilization colonizes and grows.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_CulturalAffinityDec
StringTable.String: Determines what culture tree a civilization starts with discounts towards.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_BehaviorsDec
StringTable.String: Determines how this civilization will be played when controlled by AI.

StringTable.Label: Hotspot_CitizensDec
StringTable.String: Citizens make up the population of your core worlds, they can be specialized to modify a planet's outputs or are required for building certain ship classes.

StringTable.Label: Trait_SelfGovernance_Dec_TK
StringTable.String: [I]The smallest minority is the individual. You cannot deny the individual and claim to defend minorities.[/I][BR][BR][COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Governors will never rebel[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Trait_Purges_Dec_TK
StringTable.String: [I]Your state maintains power through fear, eliminating perceived threats to its control.[/I][BR][BR] [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Unlocks Orbital Gulag [BR][BR] Unlocks ability to Purge citizens[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Trait_Prestige_Dec_TK
StringTable.String: [I]The famous will show you what a culture values. While others worship the vapid and beautiful or the bright and curious, we revere the strong.[/I][BR][BR][COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Prestige victory progress +25% [/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Trait_Censorship_Dec_TK
StringTable.String: [I]The power of censorship lies in its sinister ability to manipulate minds, suppress dissent, and control the narrative.[/I][BR][BR][COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Foreign influence on our worlds reduced by 50%[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Trait_Collaboration_Dec_TK
StringTable.String: [I]Scientific collaboration is the cornerstone of innovation, propelling us towards a future built on shared knowledge and collective discovery.[/I][BR][BR][COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Unlocks Hyperion Braintrust Improvement[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Trait_Trustworthy_Dec_TK
StringTable.String: [I]Trustworthiness is not merely a personal virtue; it is the cornerstone of lasting connections and the backbone of a cohesive community.[/I][BR][BR][COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Unlocks Nebulon Monetary Trust Improvement[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Trait_Peacefulness_Dec_TK
StringTable.String: [I]It is the steadfast commitment to peace that brings hope to the civilizations who cherish its values.[/I][BR][BR][COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+3 Diplomatic buff with every civilization for our peacefulness[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: GalacticReserve_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Position your currency as the unifying economic cornerstone of the galaxy.

StringTable.Label: OfficerSchool_ShortDec_TK
StringTable.String: A place for our best and brightest to train and be molded into officers.

StringTable.Label: WarInstitution_ShortDec_TK
StringTable.String: The minutia of every fleet battle in recorded history is studied in the halls of this space station.

StringTable.Label: ConquestCenter_ShortDec_TK
StringTable.String: This spacestation serves as the strategic hub where our brightest strategists study the art of invasions.

StringTable.Label: TacticalCollege_ShortDec_TK
StringTable.String: This spacestation provides comprehensive training in strategies for space-based combat.

StringTable.Label: TacticalInstruction_ShortDec_TK
StringTable.String: Provides in-depth training on the tactics and strategies specific to commanding larger ship classes in space combat.

StringTable.Label: LogisticsArray_ShortDec_TK
StringTable.String: This logistics array spacestation provides extensive training in state control and management of vast interstellar empires.

StringTable.Label: NetworkNexus_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Central hub for bio-electric research communication.

StringTable.Label: IrradiatedFoundry_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Radiation-fueled production hub that grows based on surrounding districts.

StringTable.Label: ContagionSource_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Propagation center for cosmic infection increases mitosis rate.

StringTable.Label: Golgi_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Central hub for cellular processing and distant vision..

StringTable.Label: Incubator_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Site for accelerated growth and fission.

StringTable.Label: KnowledgeMeld_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Convergence point for compelled shared understanding.

StringTable.Label: HiveWorkerTraining_ShortDec
StringTable.String: A facility to elevate [HS=HS_Consuming]Consuming[/HS] population [HS=HS_Diligence]Diligence[/HS] by 50%%. Effect increases as it levels up.

StringTable.Label: BrainBugs_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Epicenter for increasing [HS=HS_Consuming]Consuming[/HS] population [HS=HS_Intelligence]Intelligence[/HS] by 50%%. Effect increases as it levels up.

StringTable.Label: SocialBugs_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Enhancing [HS=HS_Consuming]Consuming[/HS]unity by increasing [HS=HS_Social]Social[/HS] skills by 50%%. Effect increases as it levels up..

StringTable.Label: Hatchery_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Birthplace of the next generation [HS=HS_Consuming]Consuming[/HS] citizens. Greatly increases growth.

StringTable.Label: WorkHive_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Productive hub for the worker caste of [HS=HS_Consuming]Consuming[/HS] by increasing their [HS=HS_Diligence]Diligence[/HS].

StringTable.Label: MotherHive_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Central hub for [HS=HS_Consuming]Consuming[/HS] species on this world. Increases the stats of all creatures with the [HS=HS_Consuming]Consuming[/HS] trait.

StringTable.Label: ExterminatorsAbility_Dec
StringTable.String: Transport ships are replaced with planet killing Spore Ships.

StringTable.Label: GenocidalAbility_Dec
StringTable.String: Massive advantage in conquering planets due to not caring in the least about collateral damage. [BR][BR]Can convert other species unfortunate enough to end up on their planets into living neural network batteries.

StringTable.Label: MasterTech_StarshipRefits_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows ships to be upgraded with the best equipment.

StringTable.Label: MasterTech_StarshipRefits_Dec
StringTable.String: When it comes to upgrading existing ships, there is no simple solution. Engineers must solve the problem of getting components out to ships in space and then devise safe methods to replace old weapons and armor with the latest and greatest technology.

StringTable.Label: MasterTech_ReallyLateStageCapitalism_ShortDec
StringTable.String: First step to ensuring our currency is the galactic reserve currency.

StringTable.Label: MasterTech_ReallyLateStageCapitalism_Dec
StringTable.String: Money is what will detemrine who rules this galaxy. And the civilization who controls the most trusted form of currency will be in the best position to control the flow of money. [BR][BR]In the vast cosmic expanse where myriad civilizations vie for dominance, a profound understanding of economic structures is indispensable. The "Trade Networks" technology represents a sophisticated endeavor aimed at achieving an economic zenith: positioning one's currency as the epicenter of the galactic economy.[BR][BR]Within this ambit, a reserve currency transcends its rudimentary function as a transactional medium. It emerges as an emblem of economic prowess—a universally acknowledged benchmark against which the financial robustness of other currencies is gauged. The custodian of such a formidable currency enjoys manifold advantages, ranging from facilitating frictionless interstellar commerce to securing preferential exchange rates. More significantly, this custodianship bestows upon its holder a potent instrument in the orchestra of diplomatic and economic dialogues.[BR][BR]Beyond its transactional supremacy, the galactic reserve currency serves as a bulwark against economic vicissitudes. It becomes a coveted asset, zealously accumulated by civilizations galaxy-wide, thereby perpetuating its demand and reinforcing its fiscal stature. The strategic privilege of directing monetary policies, afforded to the progenitor of this currency, wields the power to sculpt the contours of the overarching galactic economy.[BR][BR]In essence, the pursuit of the Trade Networks technology is not merely a quest for economic ascendancy; it represents a philosophical commitment to reshaping the very sinews of galactic commerce, diplomacy, and power dynamics.

StringTable.Label: MasterTech_TechnologicalAssimilation_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows us to use alien technologies as our own.

StringTable.Label: MasterTech_TechnologicalAssimilation_Dec
StringTable.String: The other civilizations in this galaxy have a wide variety of technologies and concepts that are alien to us. We must adapt and make use of these. [BR][BR]Within the intricate tapestry of interstellar entities, a new paradigm emerges: the amalgamation of technology. It's not about mere acquisition but about seamless integration. [BR][BR]Technological Assimilation operates on the principle that true power doesn't rest in suppressing or destroying the knowledge of the subdued but in embracing and elevating it. By assimilating the technological advancements of various civilizations into one's own, a society can leapfrog stages of development and position itself at the vanguard of innovation. [BR][BR]It's a pragmatic approach, transforming potential adversaries into unwitting allies. Civilizations that once posed threats could now be reservoirs of knowledge, waiting to be tapped. The ability to decipher, understand, and then incorporate different technological languages into one's own is a testament to both the adaptability and vision of a ruling entity. [BR][BR]However, this journey isn't devoid of challenges. It demands an intricate understanding of alien frameworks, vast repositories to store knowledge, and the flexibility to modify one's own societal structures. Yet, the rewards far outweigh the risks, paving the path for a civilization's ascendancy to unprecedented technological heights. [BR][BR]In pursuing Technological Assimilation, an empire not only augments its own capabilities but also ensures its legacy as a beacon of knowledge, innovation, and progress in the galactic annals.

StringTable.Label: MasterTech_Hatcheries_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Optimized birthplaces for our future swarm.

StringTable.Label: MasterTech_Hatcheries_Dec
StringTable.String: The intricate lifecycle of our species requires dedicated spaces where the next generation can be nurtured, protected, and prepared for the challenges of the cosmos. [BR][BR]Hatcheries are not mere breeding grounds. They are crucibles of evolution, innovation, and communal effort. Every hatchery pulsates with the rhythm of countless lives, waiting to be ushered into our vast collective. [BR][BR]This technological advancement goes beyond mere architecture or biology. It taps into the very essence of our species' resilience and adaptability. By refining and enhancing our hatcheries, we not only increase the strength and numbers of our swarm, but we also imbue each new individual with the knowledge and capabilities gleaned from countless generations before. [BR][BR]But the journey to perfect our hatcheries is laden with challenges. It requires a deep understanding of our biology, a commitment to protect each egg from potential threats, and the foresight to prepare each newborn for a universe filled with unknowns. [BR][BR]In pursuing the Hatcheries Advancement, we are not only ensuring the future of our species but also echoing our timeless values and unwavering dedication to the swarm. With each hatchery, we are sowing the seeds of our legacy, ensuring that our song resonates throughout the galaxy, now and forever.

StringTable.Label: Quest_BluffingPirate_Dec
StringTable.String:
Your survey ship approaches a peculiar signal it picked up orginating from a space junk field. When the ship finally locates the object emitting the signal and approaches, a voice comes on over the ships intercom.
"Behold! You are trapped in the clutches of Captain Starbeard, *bark-bark* ...and me first mate Nebula, the greatest pirates in the galaxy! Surrender your credits now, lest ye face the wrath of me flagship The Cosmos Dread and her intrepid fleet"
Upon further scanning, "The Cosmos Dread" appears to be little more than a mining vessal manned by 2 life forms. Dozens of communications signals from "ships" are detected, but scans indicate there is nothing but space junk.

StringTable.Label: Quest_BluffingPirate_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: What do ye say you join our ranks, oh fearsome Starbeard?

StringTable.Label: Quest_BluffingPirate_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Offer a "privateer" mission for The Cosmos Dread and her crew.

StringTable.Label: Quest_GalacticConservation_Dec
StringTable.String:
The Intergalactic Wildlife Conservancy (IWC) would like to collect specimens from around the galaxy for study. Specifically, their hope is to gather creatures suited to living in many different kinds of enviornments to better understand the biodiversity and adaptability throughout the cosmos. They agree the best place to gather new data is from uncolonized terrestrial planets.
The IWC is offering a grant to aid them in their study. It includes a free colony ship full of explorers and scientists ready to be sent off to study.

StringTable.Label: Quest_GalacticConservation_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: We are glad to accept the grant and aid the IWC in their efforts.

StringTable.Label: Quest_GalacticConservation_Liberty_Bonus_Dec
StringTable.String: Start A Mission Free Colony Ship

StringTable.Label: Quest_GalacticConservation_Liberty_QuestDescription
StringTable.String: The IWC has asked for us to colonize terrestrial planets so that they may study the wildlife throughout the galaxy.

StringTable.Label: Quest_GalacticConservation_End_Dec
StringTable.String:
The Intergalactic Wildlife Conservency (IWC) is pleased to report the success of the galactic conservation program. Our presence on these planets will allow us to learn more about the natural edens of the galaxy and the creatures that inhabit them.
With the success of the progam the IWC has commissioned "The Arc". A ship full of live specimens from around the galaxy. It is intended to be a flying ecology lab, restoring ecosystems throughout the galaxy. The Arc has been entrusted to us, for our support of the IWC's conservation efforts.

StringTable.Label: Quest_GalacticConservation_End_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: We will make great use of The Arc.

StringTable.Label: Quest_ExpandReach_Dec
StringTable.String: The leadership council believes we need to rapidly expand our civilization's reach to more planets. They are concerned we do not have enough colonies to sustain our population growth and resource needs.

StringTable.Label: Quest_ExpandReach_Liberty_QuestDescription
StringTable.String: We must establish more colonies as directed by the leadership council.

StringTable.Label: Quest_ExpandReach_End_Dec
StringTable.String: We have successfully established three new colonies, expanding the reach of our civilization. This will provide the resources and population growth the leadership council desired.

StringTable.Label: Quest_ExpandReach_End_Liberty_Bonus_Dec
StringTable.String: Increased growth on all core worlds

StringTable.Label: Quest_ExpandTrade_Dec
StringTable.String: The leadership council believes we need to expand our trade network with other civilizations. This will allow us to exchange resources and technology more efficiently.

StringTable.Label: Quest_ExpandTrade_Liberty_QuestDescription
StringTable.String: We must establish more trade routes with other civilizations as requested by the council.

StringTable.Label: Quest_ExpandTrade_End_Dec
StringTable.String: We have created several new trade routes, greatly improving our exchange of resources and technology with other civilizations.

StringTable.Label: Quest_ExpandInfluence_Dec
StringTable.String: Our civilization has grown stagnant and isolated. The leadership council believes we must take bold action to expand our influence among the stars. By constructing new starbases in strategic systems, we can project our power and make valuable contacts with independent colonies and alien civilizations.

StringTable.Label: Quest_ExpandInfluence_Liberty_QuestDescription
StringTable.String: We must construct more starbases to expand our civilization's influence and reach.

StringTable.Label: Quest_ExpandInfluence_End_Dec
StringTable.String: Our new starbases mark our growing influence and reach in the galaxy.

StringTable.Label: Quest_RecruitLeaders_Dec
StringTable.String: Our civilization has expanded rapidly, leaving us short on qualified leaders to govern our colonies and fleets. The leadership council has issued a request for us to recruit and train more leaders to properly manage our growing empire.

StringTable.Label: Quest_RecruitLeaders_Liberty_QuestDescription
StringTable.String: We must recruit and train new leaders to govern our expanding civilization.

StringTable.Label: Quest_RecruitLeaders_End_Dec
StringTable.String: We have successfully recruited and trained new leaders to manage our colonies, fleets, and other affairs.

StringTable.Label: Quest_BuildShipyard_Dec
StringTable.String: The leadership council has identified {PLANETNAME} as a strategically valuable system for starship construction. They have requested that we build a new shipyard in orbit around {PLANETNAME} to expand our production capabilities.

StringTable.Label: Quest_BuildShipyard_Liberty_QuestDescription
StringTable.String: We must build a new shipyard in orbit around {PLANETNAME} as desired by the council.

StringTable.Label: Quest_BuildShipyard_End_Dec
StringTable.String: The new shipyard at {PLANETNAME} will greatly expand our starship construction capabilities for the region.

StringTable.Label: SporeShip_Dec
StringTable.String: Carries deadly spores to wipe out the entire population of a world, and the colonists to re-colonize it.

StringTable.Label: SporeModule_Dec
StringTable.String: During invasion, kills the entire population of the world.

StringTable.Label: Campaign_TheOpportunity_ClaimFivePlanets_Dec
StringTable.String: Planets can be claimed through [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonization[/HS] unless they're already inhabited. In that case, they can be [HS=HS_ConqueringPlanets]Conquered[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Campaign_TheOpportunity_ConstructThreeProbes_Dec
StringTable.String: Construct 3 Probes from the [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS]. Probes are necessary to explore the uncharted [HS=HS_Sector]Sector[/HS] and find the source of whatever signal was detected before.

StringTable.Label: Campaign_TheOpportunity_ConstructThreeStarbases_Dec
StringTable.String: [HS=HS_Starbase]Starbases[/HS] are essential to supporting the Empire. They are required to gather the [HS=HS_StrategicResource]Strategic Resources[/HS] necessary to construct particular types of starships and weaponry.[BR][BR]Produce [HS=HS_Constructor]Constructors[/HS] from the [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS] and then use their [HS=HS_ConstructStarbase]Construct Starbase[/HS] command.

StringTable.Label: Campaign_TheOpportunity_ResearchPlanetryInvasion_Dec
StringTable.String: Research the Planetary Invasion [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS] in the [HS=HS_ResearchCenter]Research Center[/HS]. The [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS] is needed to construct Transport ships that allow us to besiege and [HS=HS_ConqueringPlanets]Conquer[/HS] hostile planets.

StringTable.Label: Campaign_Tutorail_UseProbe_Dec
StringTable.String: Give orders to the Probe until all its [ICON=Moves_Icon] [HS=HS_Moves]Moves[/HS] have been utilized. Select the Probe and use it to explore the galaxy.

StringTable.Label: Campaign_Tutorail_SurveyFirstAnomaly_Dec
StringTable.String: Utilize the [HS=HS_SurveyShip]Survey Ship[/HS] to [HS=HS_SurveyOrder]Survey[/HS] an [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomaly[/HS]. [HS=HS_SurveyOrder]Surveying[/HS] an [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomaly[/HS] takes several [HS=HS_Months]Months[/HS] of uninterrupted work. If the [HS=HS_SurveyShip]Survey Ship[/HS] is moved or given different orders, it will lose all progress toward uncovering the [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomaly[/HS].[BR][BR]Select that [HS=HS_SurveyShip]Survey Ship[/HS] using the LEFT Mouse Button and give it orders to [HS=HS_SurveyOrder]Survey[/HS] an [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomaly[/HS]. This can be done by setting an [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomaly[/HS] as the ship's destination with the RIGHT Mouse Button.

StringTable.Label: Campaign_Tutorail_SurveyTargetAnomalies_Dec
StringTable.String: Utilize the [HS=HS_SurveyShip]Survey Ship[/HS] to [HS=HS_SurveyOrder]Survey[/HS] several [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomalies[/HS]. Plenty of unknown items are in space -left behind intentionally or unintentionally. Mastering the stars will require us to discover and address many [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomalies[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Campaign_Tutorail_ColonizeFirstPlanet_Dec
StringTable.String: Utilize the Colony Ship to [HS=HS_ColonizeOrder]Colonize[/HS] a planet. Mars is a near-perfect candidate. Mars can provide beneficial resources and is close to the Alliance's Home World.[BR][BR]Select that Colony Ship using the LEFT Mouse Button and give it orders to [HS=HS_ColonizeOrder]Colonize[/HS] a planet. This can be done by setting a colonizable Planet as the ship's destination with the RIGHT Mouse Button.

StringTable.Label: Campaign_Tutorail_UnlockPolicyScreen_Dec
StringTable.String: Access the [HS=HS_ResearchCenter]Research Center[/HS] and ensure the current [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS] being researched is Colonial Pollicies. How many [HS=HS_Months]Months[/HS] the [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS] takes to research is determined by the Research rating across all [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core Worlds[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Campaign_Tutorail_EnactAPolicy_Dec
StringTable.String: [HS=HS_Policy]Policies[/HS] are a way to affect every Colony and fleet in a civilization. Enact a [HS=HS_Policy]Policy[/HS] under the [ICON=Menu_CivilizationMenu_Icon] [HS=HS_CivilizationMenu]Civilization Menu[/HS] to help accomplish goals. [HS=HS_Policy]Policies[/HS] can be changed anytime during your turn to better suit changing circumstances.

StringTable.Label: Campaign_Tutorail_RushPlanetaryImprovement_Dec
StringTable.String: To [HS=HS_Rush]Rush[/HS] a Planetary Improvement, select a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS] and open the Management window. Selecting any item in the Build Queue with the LEFT Mouse Button will bring up some contextual options. Among those is the [HS=HS_Rush]Rush[/HS] option. As long as you have the [ICON=Stat_Control_Icon] [HS=HS_Control]Control[/HS] and [ICON=Stat_Credits_Icon] [HS=HS_Credit]Credits[/HS] required, selecting the [HS=HS_Rush]Rush[/HS] option will [HS=HS_Rush]Rush[/HS] the specific improvement. The [HS=HS_Rush]Rush[/HS] option will be grayed out and unresponsive if you do not have the necessary resources.

StringTable.Label: Campaign_Tutorail_UseExecutiveOrder_Dec
StringTable.String: [ICON=Menu_ExecutiveOrders_Icon] [HS=HS_ExecutiveOrders]Executive Orders [/HS] are selected from the related radial option. Some will execute as soon as the usage is confirmed. Others require a target and must be directed after confirming the order. Hover the Mouse over the [ICON=Menu_ExecutiveOrders_Icon] [HS=HS_ExecutiveOrders]Executive Order[/HS] option and then use the LEFT Mouse Button to select an order.

StringTable.Label: Campaign_Tutorail_MineAnAsteroid_Dec
StringTable.String: (PLACEHOLDER) Brief description of the objective to mine an asteroid.

StringTable.Label: Campaign_Tutorail_BuildEconomicStarbase_Dec
StringTable.String: (PLACEHOLDER) Brief description of the objective to build an economic starbase.

StringTable.Label: Campaign_Tutorail_UnlockAsteroidMining_Dec
StringTable.String: (PLACEHOLDER) Brief description of the objective to mastering the Asteroid Mining tech.

StringTable.Label: TURNS_TO_UPGRADE_EXPLANATION_TOOLTIP
StringTable.String: The number of Months it will take to complete upgrades to this ship.[BR][BR]Value is determined by the distance to the nearest Shipyard. The closer a ship is to a Shipyard, the fewer Months it takes to complete.[BR][BR]This ship is %u tiles away from the nearest Shipyard {OBJECTNAME}.

StringTable.Label: CUSTOM_FACTION_CHOOSE_PIC_CITIZEN_FG_INFOTEXT_GENERATED
StringTable.String: Pick the image you feel best suits your leader:

StringTable.Label: GovernorRebelledMessage
StringTable.String: The traitor, {LEADERNAME}, has rebelled and formed their own empire called {PLAYERFACTIONLONG}.

StringTable.Label: GovernorJoinedRebellion
StringTable.String: The traitor, {GOVERNORNAME}, has rebelled and joined the {PLAYERFACTIONLONG}.
